result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Perri
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:56 AM Defendant Brandon B Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has filed a speedy trial demand.  
After further consultation with the defendant the Defense is withdrawing the speedy trial demand at this time.
Defendant would like to have a resolution from his revocation hearing first.
Court addresses defendant's motion to dismiss.
Defendant requests new counsel.
Attorney Jochman moves to withdraw.
Court grants motion to withdraw and orders the Public Defender's Office to appoint successor counsel.
State notes the discovery was already sent.  
Attorney Jochman advises that the standard practice is to return the packet of discovery to the Public Defender's Office to be available for successor counsel.
Court notes the motion to dismiss is titled in the CCAP record as a letter and should be renamed.
Court will address the motion to dismiss as well as the motion to modify bail after successor counsel is appointed.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial, filed by Atty. Alberti.

Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty. Alberti. 
Clerk set for hearing on 6-10-22.

Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.
